Package View_controller

Class ModifyProductController

  • java.lang.Object
    • View_controller.ModifyProductController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class ModifyProductController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The ModifyProductController class implements the Initializable class and houses all the methods and fields needed to give the application interactivity on the ModifyProduct application window.
    Author:
    JamesBundtrock

      • ModifyProductController

        public ModifyProductController​(Inventory inv,

        This is the constructor for this controller.
        Parameters:
        inv - The Inventory instance that this controller is manipulating and passes from one window to the next within our application.
        product - the Product object to be modified

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        This override on the initialize method set this application window's fields to the product instance values. It does this by calling the generateProductData method. It also generates the partSearchingTable and associatedPartTable.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the locations is not known.
        rb - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
        See Also:
        Initializable.initialize(URL, ResourceBundle)

      • generateProductData

        private void generateProductData()
        Sets the field values to that of the passed Product object, product. It also populates the associatedPartTable with all parts associated with this product.

      • generateSearchTable

        private void generateSearchTable()
        Pulls the inventory and populates the partSearchingTable with all available Part objects except those already associated with this product.

      • errorAddProduct

        private void errorAddProduct​(int type,
                             javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This is the main error reporting method called when known exceptions or logic errors occur. If the error can be traced to a specific TextField, this method will border it in crimson.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of error
        field - the TextField where the error occurred, or null if no specific TextField can be determined to be the source of the error

      • fieldErrorTrigger

        private void fieldErrorTrigger​(javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This method colors a crimson border around any TextField passed to it. Always called by the errorAddProduct, but sometimes passed null values when error cannot be determined to be within a TextField.
        Parameters:
        field - the TextField to border with crimson, or null if no border is to be changed

      • partSearch

        private void partSearch​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Generates a new partSearchingTable based off of a search of the inventory for the text inside the searchForPart TextField. First, it looks for and adds any partial or full matches based on the String name. Then it searches once more, if the input is a whole number, for a full match based on the int value of id. If no matches are found, an error message pops up to tell the user. Also, to help prevent duplicate parts in the associated parts list, the final result is stripped of any parts already within the associated parts list. If the searchForPart TextField is empty (or the parts found all already exist as associated parts), all parts in the inventory not associated with the product are shown.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • onEnterKeySearch

        private void onEnterKeySearch​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Generates a new partSearchingTable based off of a search of the inventory for the text inside the searchForPart TextField. First, it looks for and adds any partial or full matches based on the String name. Then it searches once more, if the input is a whole number, for a full match based on the int value of id. If no matches are found, an error message pops up to tell the user. Also, to help prevent duplicate parts in the associated parts list, the final result is stripped of any parts already within the associated parts list. If the searchForPart TextField is empty (or the parts found all already exist as associated parts), all parts in the inventory not associated with the product are shown.
        Parameters:
        event - An enter key stroke ideally

      • addAssociatedPart

        private void addAssociatedPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Adds an associated Part object to this Product object's associated part list.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • removeAssociatedPart

        private void removeAssociatedPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Removes an associated Part object from this Product object's associated part list.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • cancelModifyProduct

        private void cancelModifyProduct​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Cancels the modification of this Product to the inventory and sends the user back to the Main Screen. Gives the user a confirmation window prior to fully triggering.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • resetFieldColors

        private void resetFieldColors()
        This method resets the borders to gray.

      • modifyProduct

        private void modifyProduct​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method gives the save button on the ModifyProduct window functionality, as it checks the TextField values for logical and type errors. Any errors found call the errorAddProduct method. This method also clears any crimson borders prior to calling the errorAddProduct method, so that any new errors are easier to visually see to the user. If the TextField values pass validation and logic checks, and there is at least one associated part, the Product is overwritten, and the user is put back to the MainScreen.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • saveChangesToProduct

        private void saveChangesToProduct()
        This method pulls the values of the already validated TextField objects and parses their text values into their respective data types. Using these parsed values and this associatedPartList, it creates a new instance of a Product object and overwrites the old product using the updateProduct method.

      • valueCheck

        private boolean valueCheck​(javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This method checks each passed TextField for validity. The field must not be empty, and the price TextField cannot be less than zero. This also catches exceptions if invalid (such as letters) values are attempted to be parsed as a Double.
        Parameters:
        field - The TextField being checked
        Returns:
        The flag is False if no error found, or True if any error is found.

      • typeCheck

        private boolean typeCheck​(javafx.scene.control.TextField field)
        This method checks any TextField passed to it for being valid numbers for the data type. For the price field, it checks to see if it is a valid decimal number (or can be correctly parsed into one). For any other field passed to it, it checks to see if it is a valid whole number.
        Parameters:
        field - The TextField being checked
        Returns:
        Returns True if an error is found, False if no error is found

      • mainScreenReturn

        private void mainScreenReturn​(javafx.event.Event event)
        Redirects the user to the MainScreen and changes the controller to the MainScreenController.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click on either the cancel or save buttons
